projects.title: Technovanza Event Website
projects.company_role: Lead Developer at Jerusalem College of Engineering
projects.description: Led the development of the official website for Technovanza, the college's national technical symposium. Built with Vue.js, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS, featuring a dynamic event schedule and registration system.

projects.title: Point of Sale (POS) System
projects.company_role: Full Stack Intern at SBV Technologies
projects.description: Developed and deployed a comprehensive POS system using Flask for the backend and a responsive Vue.js frontend. The system handled inventory management, sales tracking, and user authentication.

projects.title: CI/CD Pipeline Automation
projects.description: Designed and implemented a complete CI/CD pipeline using Jenkins and Docker to automate the build, test, and deployment process for a suite of microservices, reducing deployment time by 40%.

projects.title: Headless CMS Platform
projects.description: Contributed to building a headless CMS for a digital marketing agency. Focused on creating a scalable backend with Node.js and a highly interactive admin dashboard using React and TypeScript.

projects.title: 2D Pixel Art Platformer
projects.description: Developing a 2D retro-style platformer game in Unity using C#. The project focuses on procedural level generation and creating a compelling player physics engine from scratch.

projects.title: Portfolio Website v1
projects.description: My first personal portfolio website built with plain HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. It was a great learning experience in web development fundamentals and responsive design.

summary_points: Assisted with development and deployment of a dashboard for product management.
Collaborated with cross-functional teams to define project requirements and timelines.
Tracked project milestones and deliverables, ensuring on-time completion.
Mentored junior developers and students in web development fundamentals.
Conducted code reviews and provided constructive feedback.
Helped organize workshops on topics like Git, Docker, and React.
